This is a figure \@ref(fig:children):

```{r children, fig.cap='Average household size by per capita consumption quintile', out.width='80%', fig.asp=.75, fig.align='center', echo=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
knitr::include_graphics("./figures/Children.png")
```

To show your STATA commands you can try: 

```markdown
  sum poor190 [aw=wgt]
```

To import table from csv file:

```{r latest, echo=FALSE, warning=FALSE, eval=TRUE, error=FALSE, results='markup', tidy=TRUE, cache=FALSE}
library(readr)
latest <- read_csv("./tables/latest.csv",col_names = TRUE, col_types = cols())
knitr::kable(latest,booktabs=TRUE, caption = 'Latest household surveys available in SARMD')
```

Or transform table with https://www.tablesgenerator.com/markdown_tables
